SourcedStatement: The U.S. Army was making 14,000 artillery shells a month prior to the conflict. Now, officials at the plant told Morning Edition that the army is producing 36,000 shells a month, up from 24,000 just six months ago.
Name: Scranton Army Ammunition Plant

SourcedStatement: The Tobyhanna Army Depot, which specializes in logistics support and radar equipment for foreign allies such as Ukraine, estimates that the company has a $2.4 billion dollar impact on the area and that it is the largest industrial employer in the region.
Name: Tobyhanna Army Depot
Justification: specializes in logistics support and radar equipment for foreign allies such as Ukraine

SourcedStatement: Officials at Tobyhanna estimate that its average annual salary is $30,000 higher than the average salary in northeastern Pennsylvania, which is around $58,000 in 2021.
Name: Tobyhanna Army Depot

SourcedStatement: Ukraine has said that it will need more ammunition from The United States and other allies, since Russia is able to produce ammunition at a much faster rate.
Name: Ukraine
Justification: Ukraine has said that it will need more ammunition from The United States and other allies

SourcedStatement: The Biden administration announced this month it would be sending an additional $250 million dollars worth of new military aid to Ukraine, including air defense missiles and 155mm howitzer rounds.
Name: Biden administration
Justification: announced this month it would be sending an additional $250 million dollars worth of new military aid to Ukraine

SourcedStatement: “We’re all about quality jobs, and that’s a quality organization,” Bob Durkin, the president and chief executive officer of the Scranton Chamber of Commerce said. “So the infusion of additional funding to support is important to us.”
Name: Bob Durkin
Title: president and chief executive officer of the Scranton Chamber of Commerce
Justification: the president and chief executive officer of the Scranton Chamber of Commerce

SourcedStatement: “It’s not $277 million that stays here. But, you know, it’s a good chunk of it,” Cartwright said. “And it’s important that we keep that work coming.”
Name: Matt Cartwright
Title: Congressman who sits on the House Appropriations Committee and represents Scranton and other parts of Northeastern Pennsylvania
Justification: Congressman who sits on the House Appropriations Committee and represents Scranton and other parts of Northeastern Pennsylvania

SourcedStatement: “I don’t really think that people dwell or concentrate on anything that’s going on outside of their sphere of influence,” Rich Hansen, the Commander’s Representative at the Scranton Army Ammunition Plant, said. we’re kind of busy concentrating on what’s going on in Scranton.”
Name: Rich Hansen
Title: Commander’s Representative at the Scranton Army Ammunition Plant
Justification: Commander’s Representative at the Scranton Army Ammunition Plant

SourcedStatement: “We had a job fair in the middle of a heat wave and there was still a line going out of the door,” Danielle Weinschenk, the lead Public Affairs Specialist at the Tobyhanna Army Depot said. “We had another one when it was pouring rain, and the same thing happened.”
Name: Danielle Weinschenk
Title: lead Public Affairs Specialist at the Tobyhanna Army Depot
Justification: lead Public Affairs Specialist at the Tobyhanna Army Depot

SourcedStatement: “With the Ukraine support, you know, one day I was sitting there thinking about what needs to be done, and it kind of hit me that what we were doing directly affects whether people live or die,” said Jim Jarick, a senior technology center engineer at the Tobyhanna Army Depot. “If we aren’t doing our job correctly, people could die tomorrow. And that just put this whole thing in perspective for me.”
Name: Jim Jarick
Title: senior technology center engineer at the Tobyhanna Army Depot
Justification: senior technology center engineer at the Tobyhanna Army Depot
